alert.note: Alert for Northeast Plains (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued March 05 at 3:19AM MST until March 05 at 6:00PM MST by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT TODAY FROM NOON TO 6 PM MST ACROSS THE EASTERN PLAINS OF NEW MEXICO DUE TO STRONG WINDS AND LOW HUMIDITY... ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FOR SUNDAY AFTERNOON FOR PORTIONS OF THE RIO GRANDE VALLEY AND THE EAST CENTRAL PLAINS OF NEW MEXICO DUE TO STRONG WINDS AND LOW HUMIDITY... .Strong winds and low humidity are expected to redevelop this afternoon in the eastern plains of New Mexico. In addition, above average temperatures and an unstable atmosphere are expected to align over these areas where critical fire weather conditions will one again threaten. Windy conditions will return on Sunday, especially along and south of Interstate 40. Critical fire weather will be possible Sunday afternoon in portions of the Rio Grande valley and the east central plains of New Mexico where humidity will plummet again. ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM NOON TODAY TO 6 PM MST THIS EVENING... The National Weather Service in Albuquerque has issued a Red Flag Warning...which is in effect from noon today to 6 PM MST this evening. The Fire Weather Watch is no longer in effect. * AREA AND TIMING...This includes the Northeastern Plains of New Mexico for this afternoon. * 20 FOOT WINDS...Westerly at 25 to 35 mph with gusts near 50 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...Dropping between 13 and 15 percent. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in the field of this Red Flag Warning for today.
